article.headline: Georgia Southern 93, Fort Valley St. 73
article.story: STATESBORO, Ga. (AP) -- Louis Graham led with 16 points as 13 of 15 players who saw action scored for Georgia Southern in a 93-78 victory over Fort Valley State on Monday night. It was the seventh victory in a row for the Eagles (7-1) who dropped their season opener at Florida State. Willie Powers added 15 points for the Eagles and Antoine Johnson had 14 points in 13 minutes. Martrez Scott led the Wildcats (1-3) with 18 points while Desmond Williams added 12 and Tony Omotayo 11. Fort Valley stayed with the Eagles for half of the first half before GSU pulled away to a 50-36 halftime lead. Southern stretched its lead to 30 points in the second half before the Wildcats rallied against reserves.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
